column4: I'm going to be doing a lot of telnet'ing.  What is a good client to do this (other than terminal)
I'd consider doing it through command-line is the best way.
You could try PuTTY if you really do not want to use command line.
Though.. it is not much different..
The reason I ask is because when I was using Telnet on a portal I have, every time I hit delete it would put a strange character...
Any clue why that would be, or how to fix that?
I think I might know.
One second.
okay :)
you can configure what the terminal generates on backspace.
At least, with gnome-terminal
It only does that when I telnet... but its still configurable?
I am not sure.
k
You could also try using netcat instead of telnet.
Got it in options, thanks.
Is it possible to configure an application to open on the push of a button... ie: If I push f12, terminal opens.?
How do you configure a button to open an application?
yes.
I think it's in System Preferences under hotkey setup.
Thanks
